info.game_comments:
1998 Celebrity Jeopardy! Ladies Night.

(Alex: Stay right where you are, because coming up next, a very special edition of Jeopardy!.)

(1, 1).clue: He launched his Polo sport line in 1993 -- what a sport!

(2, 1).clue: It's party time in New Orleans when you hear "If Ever I Cease to Love You", the official song of this festival

(3, 1).clue: This supermodel can be seen wearing an Omega wristwatch in the magazine whose name is her first name

(4, 1).clue: It's where Fats Domino found his thrill in 1956

(5, 1).clue: Stars in front of this famous theater include Basil Rathbone's, William Shatner's & Billy Graham's

(2, 2).clue: Sports fans love this kind of picnic, often held in a parking lot & named for part of a car

(3, 2).clue: The famous black shirt of this country singer who walked the line hangs on the line in Arrow ads

(4, 2).clue: Pick me up some spices if you're going to this Simon & Garfunkel "Fair"

(5, 2).clue: Marilyn Monroe's "McStar" shines in front of this Hollywood Boulevard eatery

(1, 3).clue: This designer of Tommy jeans opened his flagship store in Beverly Hills in 1997

(2, 3).clue: This word for a festive dance party may be an alteration of shindy, a synonym for an uproar

(3, 3).clue: Exuberant Fox football analyst & ex-coach who's the spokesman for Ace Hardware

(4, 3).clue: City mentioned in the title of the TV show whose theme is heard here:

(5, 3).clue: The stars run east & west on Hollywood Boulevard, & north & south on this street

(1, 4).clue: In July 1997 Carla Bruni & Eva Herzigova were among the models paying final respects to this designer in Milan

(2, 4).clue: At 22,205 feet, Guinness says the highest dinner party was in Peru, atop Mt. Huascaran in these mountains

(3, 4).clue: For all one's shopping needs, Rosie O'Donnell & Penny Marshall sing the praises of this national retailer

(4, 4).clue: "Start spreading the news", Ol' Blue Eyes made it here

(5, 4).clue: He's the only U.S. president you can step on

(1, 5).clue: In 1980s TV ads nothing got between Brooke Shields & this designer's jeans

(2, 5).clue: Schussboomers know the name of this after-schussing party contains the French word for "after"

(3, 5).clue: Kurt Vonnegut drew a self-portrait for this Swedish vodka's ubiquitous campaign

(4, 5).clue: This "house in New Orleans" has "been the ruin of many a poor boy"
(4, 5).correct response: the House of the Rising Sun

(5, 5).clue: You don't have to "Imagine" that this musician's star is in front of Capitol Records... that's where it is

(1, 1).clue: The pups of the harp species of these are known as whitecoats

(2, 1).clue: With this feature your phone beeps to let you talk to someone you may like more than the person on the line

(3, 1).clue: Famous blonde of the '30s who said, "When women go wrong, men go right after them"

(4, 1).clue: Recent commercials for this restaurant chain feature founder Dave Thomas answering his mail

(5, 1).clue: He reportedly said he would've paid the studio for the chance to direct his first film, "Play Misty for Me"

(6, 1).clue: First aid books say if this happens, you should "stop, drop & roll"

(1, 2).clue: Aw, wook at the doggy; this breed has been around China for over 2,000 years:

(2, 2).clue: Woodrow Wilson was the first U.S. president to hold one of these open audiences with reporters

(3, 2).clue: This Round Table wit required "Only 3 things of a man.  He must be handsome, ruthless and stupid"

(4, 2).clue: He was in his 60s when he put on a white suit & traveled the country to franchise his chicken recipe

(5, 2).clue: Rap star & underwear model who played porn star Dirk Diggler in "Boogie Nights"

(6, 2).clue: It's what's rolled out in the following:

(1, 3).clue: Once ensconced in a eucalyptus tree, these marsupials, whose name means "no drink", may stay for days

(2, 3).clue: To transmit signals, these vehicles usually maintain orbits above a fixed point on the globe

(3, 3).clue: She once said, "The more you learn about the dignity of the gorilla, the more you want to avoid people"

(4, 3).clue: In 1962 Glen Bell opened the first of these fast food restaurants in Downey, California

(5, 3).clue: (Hi, I'm Traci Bingham)  This "Baywatch" star was once a centerfold...a centerfold in the May 1990 issue of Cosmopolitan

(1, 4).clue: The Virginia or white-tailed species of this is found as far south as South America

(2, 4).clue: Samuel Goldwyn was quoted as saying movies "are entertainment", these "should be delivered by Western Union"

(3, 4).clue: This "All I Wanna Do" singer said, "To turn on your boyfriend, get naked and strap on an accordion"

(4, 4).clue: On Labor Day weekend 1997, this "royal" chain introduced a 2 patty burger to compete with the Big Mac

(5, 4).clue: She was once the talk of the town, the town of Braselton, Georgia; she owned it for a while

(6, 4).clue: In Japanese restaurants hosomaki are thin rolls of this; futomaki, thick ones

(1, 5).clue: Beatrix Potter found this rodent "Nutkin" special

(2, 5).clue: This man, whose speeches inspired the Russian Revolution, lost his speech after a series of strokes

(3, 5).clue: In "Out on a Limb" this actress mused, "Perhaps our belief in death was the gravest unreality of all"

(4, 5).clue: This chain of seafood shoppes is headquartered in Lexington, Kentucky, a long way from "Treasure Island"

(5, 5).clue: Marcel Marceau wrote a tribute to this late red-haired comedian for the Oct. 11, 1997 TV Guide

(0, 0).clue: For your information, this series that premiered in 1988 is TV's longest-running sitcom still on the air
